column3: text
Feature: End-to-End Application Flow - E2I Main Workspace

--This feature validates end-to-end application flow for the E2I Main workspace where E2I posts jobs directly, sources jobseekers from its own talent pool, and hands over shortlisted candidates to partner employers.
Scenario: E2I posts job, refers jobseekers, and partner employer finalizes hiring
Given an E2I Main workspace exists
And an E2I Super Admin account exists
And a Partner Employer workspace (e.g. Test Hiring Enterprise 2) exists under E2I
And an E2I Job Owner account exists
And E2I jobseeker profiles exist in the E2I talent pool
# --- E2I Job Creation ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
And the user is on the E2I Main TA dashboard
When the user post a job via FAB on TA
Then the Employer field should be editable
And the user selects "Test Hiring Enterprise 2" as the Employer
And the Hiring Manager dropdown should list Test Hiring Enterprise 2 users
And the user selects a Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Hiring Manager
And the Job Owner dropdown should list E2I users
And the user selects an E2I Job Owner
And the E2I channel should be visible and enabled
And the Internal Employees channel should be disabled
And the External Talents channel should be disabled
When the user fills in all required job details
And submits the job
Then the job should be created successfully without approval
And the job should be immediately visible in E2I workspace
# --- Job Card & Details Validation ---
When the user views the job list
Then the job card should display correct employer, job owner, and job details
When the user opens the job details page
Then the About the Job tab should display correct information
And the Jobseeker Matches tab should be visible
And the Applicants tab should be visible
# --- Jobseeker Matching ---
When the user navigates to the Jobseeker Matches tab
Then matched E2I jobseekers should be displayed
And each jobseeker should display name, email, match score, and talent badges
When the user opens a jobseeker profile
Then the user should be able to view CV, skill matches, and skill gaps
When the user sends an invitation to a jobseeker
Then the invitation should be sent successfully
# --- Jobseeker Application ---
Given the invited jobseeker applies to the job
When the user navigates to the Applicants tab
Then the applicant should appear with status "Applied"
When the user updates the applicant status to "Shortlisted"
Then the applicant should be referred to the Partner Employer
And a referral notification email should be scheduled for the Partner Employer
# --- Partner Employer Review ---
Given the user logs in as Partner Employer Admin
When the user opens the referred job
Then only the About the Job and Applicants tabs should be visible
And the applicant should appear with status "Shortlisted"
When the Partner Employer changes the application status to "Keep In View"
Then the applicant status should become read-only for E2I users
# --- Final Hiring Outcome ---
When the Partner Employer updates the application status to "Successful"
Then the final status should be reflected in both E2I and Partner Employer workspaces
Feature: End-to-End Application Flow - "Test Hiring Enterprise 2" Partner Employer of E2I
--Given a Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Admin account exists under E2I workspace
--And an E2I Super Admin account exists
--And there are active E2I Jobseekers available in the E2I talent pool
# --- Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Job Creation ---
Given the user logs in as Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Admin
And the user is on the Test Hiring Enterprise 2 workspace main TA page
When the user creates a new job via the Create Job module
Then the Employer field should be pre-filled as "Test Hiring Enterprise 2" and disabled
And the Hiring Manager field should be pre-filled with the logged-in user and disabled
And the Job Owner field should be pre-filled as an E2I Job Owner and disabled
And only the "E2I" channel should be selectable
And Internal Employees and External Talents channels should be disabled
When the user fills in all required job details
And submits the job
Then the job should be created in "Pending Approval" status
And the job should appear in Test Hiring Enterprise 2 workspace as awaiting approval
And the job details page should show a pending approval banner
And only the job description section should be visible
# --- E2I Job Approval ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
And the user navigates to Job Posting Approval list
When the user opens the pending job created by Test Hiring Enterprise 2
Then Approve and Reject actions should be available
When the user approves the job
Then the job should become visible in E2I workspace
And the job should become visible in Test Hiring Enterprise 2 workspace
# --- E2I Talent Matching ---
Given the user is viewing the approved job as E2I Super Admin
When the user navigates to the Jobseeker Matches tab
Then matched E2I jobseekers should be displayed
And each jobseeker should display name, email, match score, and profile badges
When the user selects a jobseeker
And sends an invitation to apply
Then the invitation should be sent to the jobseeker
# --- Jobseeker Application ---
Given the jobseeker receives the invitation email
When the jobseeker accepts the invitation and applies
Then the application status should appear as "Applied" in E2I Applicants tab
# --- E2I Shortlisting ---
When the E2I user changes the application status to "Shortlisted"
Then the applicant should remain visible in E2I Applicants tab
And a referral notification email should be scheduled for Partner Employer
# --- Test Hiring Enterprise 2  Applicant Visibility ---
Given the user logs in as Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Admin
When the user opens the job details page
Then the Applicants tab should display the shortlisted applicant
And the applicant status should be "Shortlisted"
# --- Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Final Decision ---
When the Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Admin changes the applicant status to "Keep In View"
Then the applicant status should be updated successfully
And the status should become read-only for E2I users
When the Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Admin changes the applicant status to "Successful"
Then the final application status should be reflected consistently across both workspaces
Feature: End-to-End Application Flow - Google TM Only Workspace
--This feature validates end-to-end application flow for a TM only customer (Google) that is not an E2I partner, covering internal and external talent sourcing without E2I
Scenario: Google creates job, sources internal and external talents, and finalizes hiring
Given a Google workspace exists with TM subscription only
And Google is not an E2I Partner Employer
And a Google Super Admin account exists
And internal employee profiles exist for Google
And external talents are available in the marketplace
# --- Google Job Creation ---
Given the user logs in as Google Super Admin
And the user is on the Google workspace main TA page
When the user creates a new job via the Create Job module
Then the Employer field should be pre-filled as "Google" and disabled
And the Hiring Manager field should be pre-filled with the logged-in user and disabled
And the Job Owner field should be pre-filled and disabled
And the "E2I" channel should be visible but disabled
And the Internal Employees channel should be enabled
And the External Talents channel should be enabled
When the user selects both Internal Employees and External Talents channels
And fills in all required job details
And submits the job
Then the job should be created successfully without approval
And the job should be immediately visible in Google workspace
# --- Internal Talent Matching ---
When the user navigates to the Internal Matches tab
Then matched internal employees should be displayed
And each internal match should show name, email, and match score
When the user sends an invitation to an internal employee
Then the invitation should be sent successfully
# --- External Talent Unlock ---
When the user navigates to the External Matches tab
And external talents are available for this job
Then the Unlock Talents option should be displayed
When the user unlocks external talents by completing payment
Then external talent matches should be displayed
And each external match should show name, email, and match score
When the user sends an invitation to an external talent
Then the invitation should be sent successfully
# --- Talent Application ---
Given invited internal and external talents receive invitation emails
When the talents apply to the job
Then their applications should appear in the Applicants tab
And the application status should be "Applied"
And each applicant should be labeled as Internal or External accordingly
# --- Google Hiring Decision ---
When the user reviews an applicant
And changes the application status to "Keep In View"
Then the status should be updated successfully
When the user changes the application status to "Successful"
Then the final application status should be saved
And the hiring decision should be reflected correctly in the Applicants tab
Feature: End-to-End Application Flow - JobTech (TM + E2I Partner) - E2I Channel Only

--This feature validates end-to-end application flow for a JobTech workspace that subscribes to TM and is also an E2I Partner, when a job is posted exclusively to the E2I channel and processed via E2I referral.
Scenario: JobTech posts job to E2I only, E2I refers jobseekers, JobTech finalizes decision
Given a JobTech workspace exists with TM subscription
And JobTech is registered as an E2I Partner Employer
And a JobTech Super Admin account exists
And an E2I Super Admin account exists
And E2I jobseeker profiles exist in the E2I talent pool
# --- JobTech Job Creation ---
Given the user logs in as JobTech Super Admin
And the user is on the JobTech workspace main TA page
When the user creates a new job via the Create Job module
Then the Employer field should be pre-filled as "JobTech" and disabled
And the Hiring Manager field should be pre-filled with the logged-in user and disabled
And the Job Owner field should be pre-filled and disabled
And the E2I channel should be enabled
And the Internal Employees channel should be enabled
And the External Talents channel should be enabled
When the user selects only the E2I channel
And fills in all required job details
And submits the job
Then the job should be created in "Pending Approval" state
And the job should appear in the E2I job posting approval list
And the job should not be visible as an active job in JobTech workspace
# --- JobTech Pending Approval View ---
When the user opens the job details page in JobTech workspace
Then a pending approval banner should be displayed
And the user should only see the About the Job tab
And all other tabs should be disabled
# --- E2I Approval Flow ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
When the user navigates to the Job Posting Approval list
And opens the pending JobTech job
Then Approve and Reject actions should be available
When the user approves the job
Then the job should become active in E2I workspace
And the job should become visible in JobTech workspace
# --- JobTech Job Details After Approval ---
When the user logs back in as JobTech Super Admin
And opens the approved job
Then the About the Job tab should be visible
And the Jobseeker Matches tab should be visible but disabled
And the Jobseeker Matches tab should display a message indicating this is an E2I-exclusive job
And the Internal Matches tab should display a message indicating the job is not published to this channel
And the External Matches tab should display a message indicating the job is not published to this channel
And the Applicants tab should be visible
And the Applicants tab should initially be empty
# --- E2I Jobseeker Matching ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
When the user opens the approved JobTech job
And navigates to the Jobseeker Matches tab
Then matched E2I jobseekers should be displayed
And each jobseeker should show name, email, match score, and talent badges
When the user sends an invitation to an E2I jobseeker
Then the invitation should be sent successfully
# --- Jobseeker Application ---
Given the invited jobseeker applies to the job
When the user views the Applicants tab in E2I workspace
Then the applicant should appear with status "Applied"
When the user updates the applicant status to "Shortlisted"
Then the applicant should be referred to JobTech
And a referral notification email should be scheduled for JobTech
# --- JobTech Applicant Review ---
When the user logs in as JobTech Super Admin
And opens the Applicants tab for the job
Then the shortlisted applicant should be visible
And the applicant should be labeled as "E2I Jobseeker"
And the applicant details should be viewable
When the user changes the application status to "Keep In View"
Then the status should be updated successfully
And the applicant status should become read-only for E2I users
# --- Final Hiring Decision ---
When the user changes the application status to "Successful"
Then the final hiring status should be saved
And the same status should be reflected in E2I workspace
Feature: End-to-End Application Flow - JobTech Mixed Channel Job Posting
--This feature validates the end-to-end flow for JobTech workspaces that are both TM subscriber and E2I partner employers, posting jobs to multiple channels (E2I + Internal + External).
Scenario: JobTech posts job to mixed channels and handles E2I approval outcome
Given a JobTech workspace exists
And JobTech is subscribed to TM
And JobTech is registered as an E2I Partner Employer
And JobTech Admin and Hiring Manager accounts exist
And E2I Super Admin and E2I Job Owner accounts exist
And E2I jobseeker profiles exist
And Internal employee profiles exist
And External talent profiles exist
# --- JobTech Job Creation ---
Given the user logs in as JobTech Admin
And the user is on the JobTech TA dashboard
When the user creates a new job via the Create Job module
Then the Employer field should be auto-filled as "JobTech"
And the Employer field should not be editable
And the Hiring Manager field should be auto-filled as the logged-in user
And the Job Owner field should be auto-filled as JobTech
And the E2I channel should be visible and enabled
And the Internal Employees channel should be visible and enabled
And the External Talents channel should be visible and enabled
When the user selects the following channels:
--| Channel             |
| E2I                |
| Internal Employees |
| External Talents   |
And the user fills in all required job details
And submits the job
Then the job should enter "Pending E2I Approval" status
And the job should appear in JobTech workspace
And the job should appear in E2I approval request list
# --- Job Visibility During Approval ---
When the user opens the job in JobTech workspace
Then the About the Job tab should be visible
And the Internal Matches tab should be visible
And the External Matches tab should be visible
And the E2I Matches tab should be hidden or disabled
And no E2I jobseekers should be displayed
# --- E2I Approval Decision ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
And the user opens the pending approval job
When the user rejects the job
And the user provides a rejection reason
Then the job should be marked as "Rejected by E2I"
# --- Post-Rejection Behavior ---
When the user logs back in as JobTech Admin
And the user opens the job
Then the job should still be visible in JobTech workspace
And the Internal Matches tab should remain visible
And the External Matches tab should remain visible
And the E2I Matches tab should be hidden or disabled
And a rejection banner should be displayed
And the rejection banner should include:
--| Field               |
| Rejection reason    |
| Link to view reason |
# --- Internal Hiring Flow Continues ---
When the user navigates to the Internal Matches tab
And the user invites an internal employee
And the internal employee applies
Then the applicant should appear under Applicants tab
When the user updates the internal applicant status to "Hired"
Then the hiring should complete successfully
And the E2I rejection should not block internal hiring
# --- External Hiring Flow Continues ---
When the user navigates to the External Matches tab
And the user unlocks an external candidate
And the external candidate applies
Then the applicant should appear under Applicants tab
When the user updates the external applicant status to "Shortlisted"
Then the external hiring flow should proceed normally
# --- E2I Visibility Validation ---
When the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
Then the rejected job should not appear in active E2I job listings
And no E2I referrals should be possible for the job
Scenario: JobTech posts job to E2I, Internal, and External channels and E2I approves
# --- JobTech Job Creation ---
Given the user logs in as JobTech Admin
And the user is on the JobTech TA dashboard
When the user creates a new job via the Create Job module
Then the Employer field should be auto-filled as "JobTech" and disabled
And the Hiring Manager field should be auto-filled and disabled
And the Job Owner field should be auto-filled and disabled
And the E2I channel should be enabled
And the Internal Employees channel should be enabled
And the External Talents channel should be enabled
When the user selects the following channels:
--| Channel             |
--| Internal Employees |
--| External Talents   |
And the user fills in all required job details
And submits the job
Then the job should be created in "Pending E2I Approval" status
And the job should appear in the E2I approval request list
# --- Pending Approval View (JobTech) ---
When the user opens the job in JobTech workspace
Then a pending approval banner should be displayed
And the About the Job tab should be visible
And the Jobseeker Matches tab should be disabled
And the Internal Matches tab should be visible
And the External Matches tab should be visible
# --- E2I Approval ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
When the user opens the pending JobTech job
And the user approves the job
Then the job should become active in E2I workspace
And the job should become active in JobTech workspace
# --- Job Visibility After Approval ---
When the user logs back in as JobTech Admin
And opens the approved job
Then the About the Job tab should be visible
And the Jobseeker Matches tab should be visible but disabled
And the Jobseeker Matches tab should display a message indicating this is an E2I-exclusive talent pool
And the Internal Matches tab should display matched internal employees
And the External Matches tab should be visible
And the Applicants tab should be visible
# --- Internal Talent Flow ---
When the user navigates to the Internal Matches tab
And the user sends an invitation to an internal employee
And the internal employee applies to the job
Then the internal applicant should appear in the Applicants tab
And the applicant should be labeled as "Internal Employee"
When the user updates the internal applicant status to "Shortlisted"
Then the status should be updated successfully
# --- External Talent Flow ---
When the user navigates to the External Matches tab
And external matches are available
And the user unlocks external talents
Then external talent matches should be displayed
When the user sends an invitation to an external talent
And the external talent applies to the job
Then the external applicant should appear in the Applicants tab
And the applicant should be labeled as "External Talent"
# --- E2I Talent Referral Flow ---
Given the user logs in as E2I Super Admin
When the user opens the approved JobTech job
And navigates to the Jobseeker Matches tab
Then matched E2I jobseekers should be displayed
When the user sends an invitation to an E2I jobseeker
And the E2I jobseeker applies
Then the applicant should appear in E2I Applicants tab
When the user updates the E2I applicant status to "Shortlisted"
Then the applicant should be referred to JobTech
# --- Unified Applicant Review (JobTech) ---
When the user logs back in as JobTech Admin
And opens the Applicants tab
Then applicants from all channels should be displayed
And each applicant should show a source label:
| Source            |
| E2I Jobseeker     |
| Internal Employee |
| External Talent   |
When the user changes the status of an E2I applicant to "Keep In View"
Then the applicant status should become read-only for E2I users
# --- Final Hiring Decision ---
When the user marks an applicant as "Successful"
Then the final status should be reflected consistently
And the hiring outcome should be visible in both JobTech and E2I workspaces
1. Workspace Visibility & Permissions
1A. E2I Main - Permissions
Scenario: E2I can create a job without approval
Given I am logged in as an E2I user
When I create a new job
Then the job is published without approval
Scenario: E2I can select employer and ownership fields
Given I am creating a job as E2I
When the job creation form is displayed
Then Employer field is editable
And Hiring Manager field is editable
And Job Owner field is editable
Scenario: E2I can hire on behalf of a partner employer
Given Test Hiring Enterprise 2 is a partner under E2I
When I select Test Hiring Enterprise 2 as Employer
Then Hiring Managers from Test Hiring Enterprise 2 are selectable
And Job Owner must be an E2I user
Scenario: E2I sees job detail tabs
Given a job is created by E2I
When I open the job detail page
Then About Job tab is visible
And Job Seeker Match tab is visible
And Applicants tab is visible
Scenario: E2I can invite job seekers
Given I am viewing Job Seeker Match tab
When I send an invitation to a job seeker
Then the invitation action is allowed
And the email invitation will be sent to jobseeker
Scenario: E2I can shortlist or reject applicants
Given a job seeker has applied
When I change the applicant status to Shortlisted
Then the applicant status is updated
And the email shortlisted will be sent to hiring manager twice a day
1B. Test Hiring Enterprise 2 (Partner only) - Permissions
Scenario: Partner employer cannot edit jobOwner fields
Given I am logged in as Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Employer
When I open the job creation form
Then Employer field is disabled
And Hiring Manager field is disabled
And Job Owner field is disabled
And job details fields remain editable
Scenario: Partner employer can only publish to E2I channel
Given I am creating a job as Test Hiring Enterprise 2 Partner Employer
When channel options are displayed
Then E2I channel is enabled
And Internal Match channel is disabled
And External Match channel is disabled
Pending Approval state
Scenario: Job submission requires E2I approval
Given I submit a job using E2I channel
Then the job status is Pending Approval
Scenario: Partner employer sees pending approval banner
Given a job is in Pending Approval state
When I open the job detail page
Then a banner indicates the job is awaiting E2I approval
And approval actions are not available
Scenario: Partner employer can only view job description while pending
Given a job is awaiting approval
When I view the job detail
Then only the job description is visible
And no job tabs are accessible
Rejection Flow
Scenario: Partner employer sees rejection message
Given E2I rejects a job
When I view the job detail
Then a rejection banner is displayed
And the rejection reason is accessible
Approval Outcome
Scenario: Approved job is visible to E2I and partner employer
Given E2I approves a job
Then the job appears in E2I job list
And the job appears in Test Hiring Enterprise 2 job list
Job Detail Tabs After Approval
Scenario: Partner employer sees restricted job tabs
Given a job is approved
When I open the job detail page
Then About Job tab is accessible
And Applicants tab is accessible
And Job Seeker Match tab should remain empty
And Internal Match tab is should remain empty
And External Match tab is should remain empty
Applicant Visibility & Control
Scenario: Partner employer sees no applicants before shortlist
Given a job is approved
And no applicant is shortlisted by E2I
When I view the Applicants tab
Then the applicant list is empty
Scenario: Shortlisted applicant appears for partner employer
Given E2I shortlists an applicant
When I view the Applicants tab
Then the applicant appears with status Shortlisted
Scenario: Partner employer takes ownership after Keep in View
Given an applicant is Shortlisted
When Test Hiring Enterprise 2 marks the applicant as Keep in View
Then E2I can no longer change the applicant status
Scenario: Partner employer can finalize applicant outcome
Given an applicant is in Keep in View
When Test Hiring Enterprise 2 marks the applicant as Successful or Unsuccessful
Then the applicant status is updated
1C. Google (TM only) - Permissions
Scenario: TM-only company sees only its own workspace jobs
Given a company "Google" subscribes to TM only
And the company has no parent or partner workspace
When a Google user accesses the TA module
Then only jobs created by Google are visible
And no partner or external workspace jobs are visible
Scenario: Job posting fields are locked for TM-only company
Given a Google user creates a new job
When the job posting form is displayed
Then Employer field is disabled with a default value
And Hiring Manager field is disabled with a default value
And Job Owner field is disabled with a default value
Scenario: Channel selection for TM-only company
Given a Google user creates a new job
When channel options are displayed
Then E2I channel is visible but disabled
And Internal Employees channel is enabled
And External Talents channel is enabled
Scenario: TM-only company can select multiple allowed channels
Given a Google user creates a new job
When Internal Employees and External Talents channels are selected
Then the job is published to both selected channels
Scenario: Job detail tabs visibility for TM-only job
Given a job is created by Google
When the job detail page is opened
Then Job Seeker Match tab is visible but will remain empty
And Internal Match tab is visible
And External Match tab is visible
And Applicants tab is visible
Scenario: Internal Match is shown only when Internal channel is selected
Given a Google job is published to Internal Employees channel
When Internal Match tab is opened
Then matching internal employees are displayed
Scenario: External Match is visible after unlocking
Given a Google job is published to External Talents channel
And External Match feature is unlocked
When External Match tab is opened
Then external matching candidates are displayed
1D. Jobtech (TM & E2I Partner) - Permissions
Scenario: JobTech cannot edit ownership fields
Given I am logged in as JobTech user
When I open the job creation form
Then Employer field is disabled
And Hiring Manager field is disabled
And Job Owner field is disabled
And job detail fields remain editable
Scenario: JobTech can select all channels
Given I am creating a job
Then E2I channel is selectable
And Internal Employees channel is selectable
And External Talents channel is selectable
Single Channel – E2I Only (Approval required)
Scenario: Job posted to E2I only requires approval
Given I select only E2I channel
When I submit the job
Then the job status is Pending Approval
Scenario: JobTech sees restricted access for E2I-only job
Given a job is approved for E2I only
When I open the job detail
Then Job Seeker Match tab is visible but disabled
And Internal Match tab is disabled
And External Match tab is disabled
And Applicants tab is accessible
Single Channel – Internal Only (No approval)
Scenario: Job posted to Internal only does not require approval
Given I select only Internal Employees channel
When I submit the job
Then the job is published immediately
Scenario: JobTech sees internal hiring tabs
Given a job is posted to Internal only
When I open the job detail
Then Internal Match tab is accessible
And External Match tab is disabled
And Job Seeker Match tab is disabled
Single Channel – External Only
Scenario: External match is locked when posting to External only
Given I select only External Talents channel
When I open External Match tab
Then unlock prompt is shown if matches exist
Scenario: Unlock is hidden when no external matches exist
Given a job has no external matches
When I view External Match tab
Then unlock prompt is not shown
Dual Channel – Internal + External
Scenario: JobTech can access internal and external matches
Given a job is posted to Internal and External
When I open the job detail
Then Internal Match tab is accessible
And External Match tab is accessible
Dual Channel – E2I + TM Channel
Scenario: E2I rejection does not block TM channels
Given a job is posted to E2I and Internal
And E2I rejects the job
When I view the job in JobTech workspace
Then the job remains visible
And Internal Match tab is accessible
All Channels Selected
Scenario: JobTech sees all match tabs when all channels selected
Given a job is approved with all channels selected
When I open the job detail
Then Job Seeker Match tab is visible but read-only
And Internal Match tab is accessible
And External Match tab is accessible
And Applicants tab is accessible
2. Job Posting Flow
2A. E2I Job Posting (No Approval)
Scenario: E2I job is published immediately
Given I am logged in as E2I admin
When I create a job
Then the job is published without approval
Scenario: E2I selects employer and ownership fields
Given I am creating a job as E2I
When I select an employer entity
Then Hiring Manager options come from that entity
And Job Owner can be selected
Scenario: E2I job channel is restricted
Given I am creating a job as E2I
When channel options are displayed
Then only E2I channel is selectable
2B. Partner Only Job Posting (Test Hiring Enterprise 2)
Scenario: Ownership fields are disabled
Given I am logged in as Partner Employer
When I open job creation form
Then Employer field is disabled
And Hiring Manager field is disabled
And Job Owner field is disabled
Scenario: Partner channel selection is restricted
Given I am creating a job as Partner Employer
When channel options are displayed
Then E2I channel is enabled
And Internal channel is disabled
And External channel is disabled
Scenario: Partner job requires approval
Given I submit a job using E2I channel
Then the job status is Pending Approval
Scenario: Pending approval job is read-only
Given a job is pending approval
When I open the job detail
Then a pending approval banner is shown
And no job tabs are accessible
Scenario: Approved job is visible to E2I and Partner
Given E2I approves the job
Then the job appears in E2I workspace
And the job appears in Partner workspace
Scenario: Rejected job shows reason
Given E2I rejects the job
When I view the job detail
Then a rejection message is shown
And rejection reason can be viewed
2C. TM Only Job Posting (Google)
Scenario: TM-only job is published immediately
Given I am logged in as TM-only company
When I submit a job
Then the job is published without approval
Scenario: E2I channel is unavailable
Given I am creating a job as TM-only company
When channel options are displayed
Then E2I channel is disabled
And Internal channel is selectable
And External channel is selectable
Scenario: Job detail shows correct tabs
Given a job is published
When I open job detail
Then Job Seeker Match tab shows not published message
And Internal Match tab is available if selected
And External Match tab is available if selected
2D. TM + E2I Job Posting (JobTech)
Channel: E2I Only
Scenario: E2I-only job requires approval
Given I select only E2I channel
When I submit the job
Then the job status is Pending Approval
Scenario: Rejected E2I-only job is not visible
Given E2I rejects an E2I-only job
Then the job is not visible in JobTech workspace
Channel: Internal Only
Scenario: Internal-only job skips approval
Given I select only Internal channel
When I submit the job
Then the job is published immediately
Channel: Dual channel with E2I
Scenario: Job remains visible if E2I rejects but other channels exist
Given I select E2I and Internal channels
And E2I rejects the job
Then the job remains visible in JobTech workspace
And Internal Match tab is accessible
And same logic applies for E2I + External
Channel: All channels selected
Scenario: Job enters approval when E2I is selected
Given I select E2I, Internal, and External channels
When I submit the job
Then the job status is Pending Approval
Scenario: Rejected job remains visible for TM channels
Given E2I rejects the job
Then the job remains visible in JobTech workspace
3. Application Status Flow
3A. Application Status Flow - E2I Main
Scenario: E2I views job card and job details after posting
Given an E2I admin has posted a job successfully
When the admin opens the job
Then the job card details must match the posted job information
And the About the Job tab must display the correct description and required skills
Scenario: E2I views job seeker matches from E2I talent pool
Given a job is live under the E2I channel
When the admin opens the Job Seeker Matches tab
Then only E2I job seeker talents must be listed
And each talent must display name, email, match score, and talent type badges
Scenario: E2I reviews a matched talent profile
Given a talent appears in the Job Seeker Matches list
When the admin opens the talent profile
Then the talent details must include email, match score, skills match, skill gaps, and other skills
And the admin must be able to download the CV
And the admin must be able to send an invitation
Scenario: Talent applies after receiving invitation
Given an E2I admin has sent an invitation to a talent
When the talent applies via the invitation link
Then the talent must appear in the Applicants tab
And the application status must be Applied
Scenario: E2I updates applicant status to reviewed
Given a talent is in the Applicants tab with status Applied
When the admin changes the status to Reviewed
Then the application status must be updated to Reviewed
Scenario: E2I shortlists an applicant
Given a talent is in the Applicants tab
When the admin changes the status to Shortlisted
Then the applicant status must be Shortlisted
And HR or partner employer must receive email notifications
3B. Application Visibility for Partner Employer (Non-TM) - Test Hiring Enterprise 2
Scenario: Partner employer views job after E2I approval
Given a Test Hiring Enterprise 2 job has been approved by E2I
When the partner employer opens the job
Then only About the Job and Applicants tabs must be visible
Scenario: Partner employer sees applicants only after E2I shortlists
Given E2I has shortlisted a talent for the job
When the partner employer opens the Applicants tab
Then the shortlisted applicant must be visible
And no applicants must be visible before shortlisting
Scenario: Partner employer reviews applicant details
Given a shortlisted applicant is visible
When the partner employer opens the applicant profile
Then the partner employer must see name, email, match score, skills, and CV
Scenario: Partner employer takes ownership of application status
Given an applicant is shortlisted by E2I
When the partner employer changes the status to Keep in View
Then E2I must no longer be able to change the application status
Scenario: Partner employer finalizes application outcome
Given an applicant is in Keep in View status
When the partner employer updates the status to Successful or Unsuccessful
Then the final status must be reflected in both E2I and partner employer workspaces
3C. Application Status Flow for TM Customer (Non-Partner) - Google
Scenario: Google views job tabs after posting
Given Google has posted a job
When the job is opened
Then About the Job, Internal Matches, External Matches, and Applicants tabs must be visible
And the E2I channel must not be accessible
Scenario: Google manages internal match applications
Given a job is posted with Internal channel selected
When an internal employee applies
Then the applicant must appear in the Applicants tab
And Google must be able to update the application status
Scenario: Google manages external match applications
Given a job is posted with External channel selected
And Google has unlocked external talents
When an external talent applies
Then the applicant must appear in the Applicants tab
And the applicant must be marked as external talent
3D. Application Status Flow for JobTech (TM + E2I Partner Employer)
Scenario: Jobtech posts job to E2I-only channel
Given Jobtech posts a job using only the E2I channel
When the job is approved by E2I
Then applicants must be sourced only by E2I
And Jobtech must see applicants only after E2I shortlists them
Scenario: Jobtech receives shortlisted applicants from E2I
Given E2I has shortlisted a talent
When Jobtech opens the Applicants tab
Then the applicant must appear with status Shortlisted
Scenario: Jobtech posts job to Internal-only channel
Given Jobtech posts a job using only the Internal channel
When an internal employee applies
Then Jobtech must manage the application status independently
Scenario: Jobtech posts job to Internal and External channels
Given Jobtech posts a job using Internal and External channels
When talents apply
Then applicants must appear in the Applicants tab
And no E2I approval is required
Scenario: Jobtech posts job to E2I and Internal channels
Given Jobtech posts a job using E2I and Internal channels
When E2I approves the job
Then applicants from both E2I and Internal channels must appear
And applicants must be labeled by talent source
Scenario: Jobtech posts job to all channels
Given Jobtech posts a job using E2I, Internal, and External channels
When talents apply
Then applicants from all channels must appear in the Applicants tab
And each applicant must display the correct talent source badge
